histogram.name: Bluetooth.Android.GATTConnection.Disconnected.Result
histogram.summary: Disconnected GATT connection status codes. Used to better understand errors seen in Android.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Android.GATTConnection.Failure.Result
histogram.summary: Failed GATT connection error codes. Used to better understand errors seen in Android.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Android.GATTConnection.Success.Result
histogram.summary: Successful GATT connection result codes. Used to better understand Android results.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Availability.v2
histogram.summary: Determines the availability and capabilities of the Bluetooth driver. This metric is logged on startup.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.DeviceSelectionDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to select a device either after they open the UI and Bluetooth is on, or after Bluetooth turns on while the UI is open.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.Pairing.Duration.Failure
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for a failed pairing attempt, initiated from Bluetooth Settings or System Tray, to finish. If the user needed to go through an auth process during pairing, the time the user took to confirm that is not included.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.Pairing.Duration.Success
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for a successful pairing attempt, initiated from Bluetooth Settings or System Tray, to finish. If the user needed to go through an auth process during pairing, the time the user took to confirm that is not included.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.Pairing.Result
histogram.summary:
Records success or failure of a pairing attempt (initiated in the UI) to a peripheral after the user taps that device in the list of discovered peripherals in Bluetooth Settings or System Tray.
Suffixed by Bluetooth transport type. View the base histogram to see results for all transport types aggregated together, and suffixed histograms for the results of just that particular transport type.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.Pairing.Result.FailureReason
histogram.summary:
Breaks down why a pairing attempt to a peripheral failed (see 'Bluetooth.ChromeOS.Pairing.Result').
Suffixed by Bluetooth transport type. View the base histogram to see results for all transport types aggregated together, and suffixed histograms for the results of just that particular transport type.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.Pairing.TransportType
histogram.summary: An enumerated histogram which captures the transport type of devices which are paired with. Reports of transport types other than classic, BLE, or dual should be considered concerning and investigated.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.UserInitiatedReconnectionAttempt.Result
histogram.summary:
Records success or failure of a reconnection attempt to an already paired peripheral after the user taps that device in the list of peripherals in Bluetooth Settings or System Tray. Explicitly excludes automatic reconnection attempts initiated by Chrome OS.
Suffixed by Bluetooth UI surface. View the base histogram to see results for all UI surfaces aggregated together, and suffixed histograms for the results of just that particular UI surfaces.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ChromeOS.UserInitiatedReconnectionAttempt.Result.FailureReason
histogram.summary:
Breaks down why a user-initiated reconnection attempt to a peripheral failed (see 'Bluetooth.ChromeOS.UserInitiatedReconnectionAttempt.Result').
Suffixed by Bluetooth UI surface. View the base histogram to see results for all UI surfaces aggregated together, and suffixed histograms for the results of just that particular UI surfaces.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ConnectedDeviceCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of simulataneously connected Bluetooth devices. Used to direct testing efforts, and by our UI team to determine appropriate UI sizes.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.DiscoverySession.Start.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of calls to BluetoothAdapter::StartDiscoverySession. Used to prioritize efforts to fix failures of this function.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.DiscoverySession.Stop.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of calls to BluetoothDiscoverySession::Stop. Used to prioritize efforts to fix failures of this function.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Linux.ConnectToServiceInsecurelyResult
histogram.summary: Result of attempting a call to mojom::Adapter::ConnectToServiceInsecurely(). Emitted when function completes.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.MacOS.Errors
histogram.summary: Records how many times each macOS GATT error has occured. The results will be used to determine how commun this errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingMethod
histogram.summary: Records the method used to pair each Bluetooth Device. Used to direct our testing efforts.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of pairing each Bluetooth Device. Used to understand whether we are having significant problems with Bluetooth pairing and seeing errors more commonly than we should.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Android
histogram.summary: 'status' values returned by Android GATT event.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Blocklist.ParsedNonEmptyString
histogram.summary:
Records the result of BluetoothBlocklist::Add parsing a non-empty string. These strings will be updated dynamically by a server, and this histogram provides feedback that parsing is functioning correctly on clients.
False values are BAD, a blocklist is failing to be applied correctly.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.ReadValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to characteristic.readValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.StartNotifications.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to characteristic.startNofications(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.WriteValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to characteristic.writeValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ChooserInteraction
histogram.summary: Counts how many times users interact with a regular chooser vs. an invalid chooser. (A chooser is invalid when it's event handler becomes null.)

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ConnectGATT.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a device.gatt.connect() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ConnectGATT.TimeFailed
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for a connection attempt to fail. Use to let developers know how to better wait for and handle connection errors.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ConnectGATT.TimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for a device to successfully connect. Use to let developers know how long it should take to connect to a BLE device.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Descriptor.ReadValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to descriptor.readValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Descriptor.WriteValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to descriptor.writeValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristic.Characteristic
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting a characteristic. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of characteristics to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristic.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getCharacteristic(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristics.Characteristic
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting characteristics. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of characteristics to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristics.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getCharacteristics(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptor.Descriptor
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting a descriptor. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of descriptors to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptor.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getDescriptor(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptors.Descriptor
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting descriptors. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of descriptors to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptors.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getDescriptors(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryService.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a GATTServer.getPrimaryService() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryService.Services
histogram.summary: Records what GATT Services are used when connected. The record value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. This will help us know if we should build an API for specific services rather than a general Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryServices.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a GATTServer.getPrimaryServices() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryServices.Services
histogram.summary: Records what GATT Services are used when connected. The record value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. This will help us know if we should build an API for specific services rather than a general Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Filters.Count
histogram.summary: Records how many filters are used when scanning. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Filters.Services
histogram.summary: Records a 31-bit hash of the GATT Service UUIDs used when scanning. This will help us know if we should build an API for specific services rather than a general Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.FilterSize
histogram.summary: Records how many services are used in a filter. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.NumOfDevicesInChooserWhenNotAcceptingAllDevices
histogram.summary: In the case of not accepting all devices, records the number of devices that are in the chooser when a device is paired.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.OptionalServices.Count
histogram.summary: Records how many optional services are used when scanning. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.OptionalServices.Services
histogram.summary: Records what optional services are used. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Options.AcceptAllDevices
histogram.summary: Records the value of 'acceptAllDevices' in RequestDeviceOptions. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.RSSISignalStrength
histogram.summary: Raw RSSI values provided to chooser, before processing them for display in the Web Bluetooth chooser.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.RSSISignalStrengthLevel
histogram.summary: Displayed RSSI levels, after processing and as displayed to users in the Web Bluetooth chooser.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.ScanningDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration scanning for devices is run, terminated by events such as the chooser being closed with a selected device, cancelled, or the scan duration timing out.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.UnionOfServices.Count
histogram.summary: Records how many services are used when scanning. This results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.UnionOfServices.Services
histogram.summary: Records what services are used from either required or optional sets. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.
